sentences: Ta tõi välja oma vanema mõõga.
Mõõk teras lõi vastu kivi ja katkes pooleks.
context: The Estonian word 'mõõk' means sword or blade. It refers to a cutting weapon with a long, straight blade. This is an inanimate masculine noun in Estonian. In the examples provided, you can see it used in different contexts - one example shows bringing out an old sword, another describes how the steel blade broke when hitting a stone, and the third mentions soldiers each receiving a new sword.
